title.narrative: OUTPUT 3: EPAH EN MILIEU SCOLAIRE

description.narrative: By 2016, school children benefit from Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services that respect "child friendly" norms, standards and technical guidance and adopt improved sanitation and hygiene practices., which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Children, women and their families in rural and poor urban areas, especially the most vulnerable, have gained equitable and sustainable access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services as well as to hygiene education

participating-org.narrative: HOPITAL UNIVERSITE D ETAT D HAITI HUEH

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)
